frame.name: Practice
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> enacts an <fen>Action</fen> that is intended to be performed again at one or more later <fen>Occasion</fen>s. The goal of practicing is to ensure that the action at the later <fen>Occasion</fen>(s) comes off flawlessly.
<ex><fex name="Agent">I</fex> <t>practiced</t> <fex name="Action">my song</fex> <fex name="Occasion">for the play</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later <fen>Occasion</fen>.
<ex>Little Dieter <t>practiced</t> <fex name="Action">playing the piano</fex> all day.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the <fen>Action</fen> in preparation for later performances of the same type.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the place where the practicing occurs.
<ex>Our band <t>practices</t> <fex name="Place">on the football field</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Agent</fen> performs an intentional act. <ex>John <t>practiced</t> typing <fex name="Purpose">to receive a raise</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> practices.
<ex>We <t>practiced</t> the play <fex name="Time">on Tuesday</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> practices.
<ex>We <t>practiced</t> the slam dunk <fex name="Means">by bouncing on a trampoline</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the practicing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the <fen>Action</fen> (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>We <t>ran</t> through the song <fex name="Manner">at quarter speed</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Occasion
FE.definition: <def-root>The later enactment or enactments that the <fen>Agent</fen> expects to perform. Note that the <fen>Agent</fen> does not have to have specific <fen>Occasion</fen>s in mind. <ex><fex name="Occasion">For our brother's wedding</fex> we had to <t>rehearse</t> the dinner twenty times.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The period of time during which an <fen>Action</fen> is repeatedly practiced.
<ex>The troupe <t>rehearsed</t> the ballet <fex name="dur">for 4 months</fex> before going on tour.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that the Action is practiced.
<ex>We <t>practice</t> this scene <fex name="Iterations">daily</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person who participates in a practice event along with the <fen>Agent</fen>.
<ex> Then I went back to <t>rehearsing</t> <fex name="Co-participant">with the band</fex> while she sat around listening </ex></def-root>
